Articles.Content:
I have a heavily modded 1.4.3 install I set up recently.  I haven't played since 1.3.1.  

I'm seeing a weird issue where my mission flags are all pixelated/low-res both on decals placed on ships and on the banners on the interior walls of the VAB and SPH.  My google-fu seems to be failing me in finding a starting point in explaining this.  

Has anyone else seen this happening or know what the issue might be?

EDIT: In case anyone wanders in looking for the answer to this: Texture Replacer Replaced is responsible for the pixelated flags.  It's not intended behavior so you'll have to check out the thread for that mod for further info.

Edited May 30, 2018 by CaribeanSoul
Try increasing resolution in the launcher and setting. See if that works

@CaribeanSoul

Would you mind finding those flags in your game data?  A complete mod list and images of the issues would also help.

As a “mod dev” my first though is that your flag is an image that the mod uses as its icon in the contract panel. Those images are much smaller, low res, and have different height to length ratios. They are usually hidden from players but are visible if the images are in a Flags folder and not the Agency folder. 

Thats just my first though, I could be wrong.

Anyway, you could try using a stock flag. If that is still weird, you have other problems. If not, see where those flags you are using are contained in the gamedata, and give us the name of the mod, plus screenshots of the folder where the flags are, and the folder where that folder is. 

4 hours ago, Xd the great said:

Try increasing resolution in the launcher and setting. See if that works

Highly doubt that this the issue. That doesn’t affect how flags get displayed.

I've seen this happen on quite a few flags.  They are mostly custom ones that I've used without issue in previous versions of the game.  I think I've seen it on a vanilla game flag as well but I'm not 100% sure of that.  The custom flags are all 256x160 png files.

My mod list is huge.  I'm not really asking for someone to diagnose this ... was mostly hoping for someone to say "Oh yeah, I've seen that before..."  I'm just looking for a place to start.   I'll try to post the mod list later anyway in case it sparks an idea.

Mod list:
